item.title: From Afro Liberation Front "Monday 9/14 at 4pm on the East...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

From Afro Liberation Front "Monday 9/14 at 4pm on the East Steps of City Hall: Currently, the city charter of Denver prohibits bargaining over officers' discipline, policing policies, and oversight. This results in contracts that shield abusive officers from firings and prosecutions! Come help us put pressure on council to vote "NO" on the upcoming PPA Contract!!"
#DefundDPD #DefundAPD #AbolishPolice

‎Afro Liberation Front‎ to CAN YOU HEAR US NOW? Take Action @ City Hall!

Councilmembers who've cited "process" for rejecting past bills, should feel just as compelled to reject this secret agreement by Mayor Hancock & the PPA!

#DenverProtests #AbolishThePolice #milehighmornings #COVID19 #DenverProtest #M4BL #PoliceBrutality #exposethecorrupt
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Join DASHR as we support our unhoused community, distribute food...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Join DASHR as we support our unhoused community, distribute food and water, and reach out to businesses about alternatives to policing.

*Note: if you are not needing to pick up food or supplies, you can also meet us later at Benedict Fountain Park at 8:30a*

Every Sunday, we will start at Benedict Fountain Park where Compassionate Trash and Water has been supporting encampments. We will make our way to 16th Street where Boycott the Urban Camping Ban has been providing warm me...als every week.

We need:
Street medics who can help serve and treat unhoused folks
People to help distribute water and snacks
Canvassers who can help us talk to businesses about alternatives to policing

This will include walking / traveling. Please bring a mask if you can (or grab a DASHR mask at https://comaskeraid.org/shop/dashr-fundraiser-mask).

Message Denver Alliance for Street Health Response with any questions and otherwise we hope to continue building community around street health response!

See More

SUN, SEP 13 AT 8:00 AM MDT

Street Health Sundays

800 N Grant St, Denver, CO 80203-2905, United StatesCauses

item.title: On September 2nd, 2020, the young and tender life of Deon Kay, a...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

On September 2nd, 2020, the young and tender life of Deon Kay, a young king in our community, was tragically taken by the Metropolitan Police Department. Our family, our community and our city is in shock, grief, and mourning. Deon loved his family, his friends, and playing video games. He only just recently celebrated his 18th birthday about 3 weeks before his untimely and tragic death.

Our family wants to honor and celebrate his life and give him the home going service that he deserves. We are looking for the support from our community to celebrate his life well. Services are currently planned for next Tuesday, morning September 15th at 11am at The Temple of Praise at 700 Southern Ave SE Washington DC 20032.

On September 2nd, 2020, the young and tender life of Deon Kay, a young king… Pastor Delonte Gholston needs your support for The Official GoFundMe for Deon Kay

gofundme.com

The Official GoFundMe for Deon Kay, organized by Pastor Delonte Gholston

On September 2nd, 2020, the young and tender life of Deon Kay, a young king… Pastor Delonte Gholston needs your support for The Official GoFundMe for Deon KayOn September 2nd, 2020, the young and tender life of Deon Kay, a young king… Pastor Delonte Gholston needs your support for The Official GoFundMe for Deon Kay

item.content:encoded:
On #SexWorkerPrideDay this Sunday, September 14th we celebrate.
We celebrate sex workers’ self-determination.
We celebrate sex workers’ enhanced visibility.
We celebrate the achievements of sex worker led organizations.
We celebrate and we keep the fight for decriminalization going until it is won.
#Sexworkiswork#decriminalizesexwork

item.title: You think? And a "check on your Black friends" post is...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

You think? And a "check on your Black friends" post is not enough. Asking us to reach out if we need anything is not it either. What we need is a culture shift toward communities that actually care for us. Research evidenced-based peer support models and employ them. Also #Defundthegdpolice
#DEFUNDDPD #DEFUNDAPD #Blackmentalhealthmatters https://abcnews.go.com/…/black-american-anxiety-time…/story…

Police violence is affecting the mental health of Black Americans.

abcnews.go.com

Black American anxiety at all-time high, experts say

Police violence is affecting the mental health of Black Americans.Police violence is affecting the mental health of Black Americans.

item.title: Black Lives Matter 5280DiDi Rose is with DiDi Delgado.Tell a Black woman she looks beautiful today. That she’s a good person. mother....
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280DiDi Rose is with DiDi Delgado.

Tell a Black woman she looks beautiful today.

That she’s a good person. mother. partner. asset.

Tell a Black woman that you love her and are committed to showin...g her that love with your actions.

Offer us a couple of hours to free our selves and relax by cleaning, cooking, watching children, researching.

Reach out to one of us and thank us for our labor. Reach out to a Black woman and ask for her PayPal/cashapp/Venmo so you can send her something for self care or to put something on a bill.

Tell us you see us.

Tell us you need us.

Do better by us.

See More
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: “Hey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

“Hey community,

An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home, bashed in her windows, broke the counter tops, broke her bed, poured bleach on her clothing, strategically placed butcher knives throughout the home and pulled out the alarms. Can you imagine what he was planning to do to her or her children? Fortunately, she didn't come that night because of a family emergency (more like God and her angels were working overtime!). This fundraiser is an attempt to make her home whole again by fixing the damage. Can you help?”

Hey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home,… Millete Birhanemaskel needs your support for Rebuilding After Domestic Violence

gofundme.com

Rebuilding After Domestic Violence, organized by Millete Birhanemaskel

Hey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home,… Millete Birhanemaskel needs your support for Rebuilding After Domestic ViolenceHey community, An incredibly dangerous man broke into a young woman's home,… Millete Birhanemaskel needs your support for Rebuilding After Domestic Violence

item.title: ☕️ Tweet from @YoloAkili: “I really hate how suicide...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

☕️

Tweet from @YoloAkili: “I really hate how suicide prevention month every year is reduced to “check on your friends” and not universal health care, to defund the police, accessible mental health services, and peer support programs. That analysis is so corny.”

Project LETS

Suicide prevention month can be extremely difficult for people with lived experience, those who’ve attempted, those who’ve lost folks. When y’all don’t include ...us in your campaigns, we can tell 🤔 When y’all use the same tired lines, we are unaffected. When y’all tell us to reach out for help, we’ve tried. Suicide is not an individual phenomenon. It is collective. It is political. It is on ALL OF US to create a world that people want to live in. Where people feel safe and valued. Where people have access to basic needs. Posting a crisis line number without structural change is meaningless. Let’s do the real work.

STAY TUNED: In a few weeks, Project LETS will be facilitating a panel discussion — Suicide is Political. More soon.

Tweet from @YoloAkili: “I really hate how suicide prevention month every year is reduced to “check on your friends” and not universal health care, to defund the police, accessible mental health services, and peer support programs. That analysis is so corny.”

See More

The report, released Thursday, contradicts assumptions and claims by some that protests associated with the Black Lives Matter movement are spawning violence and destruction of property.

cnn.com

About 93% of racial justice protests in the US have been peaceful, a new report finds

item.title: #CallToAction...
item.content:encoded:
#CallToAction
HAPPENING NOW: Your mayor and council members are meeting to discuss the 2-year contract with #DenverPoliceDepartment that increases their budget in the second year. This budget increase allows for MORE funds devoted to the chemical weapons they terrorize our city with! They plan to quietly vote on it tomorrow 9/3 with only online public comment that they can control the narrative on with the click of a button. Contact your council member and Michael B. Hancock TODAY and let them know as their constituent you DEMAND they do not support the following:

❌Any Collective Bargaining Agreement with DPD longer than 1 year.

❌Any agreement that gives ANY financial increases or incentives to police.

❌Any agreement that does not require police to be financially responsible for their attorneys and settlements in any cases of alleged excessive force or race related discrimination

#DEFUNDPOLICE #DEFENDBLACKLIFE
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching...
item.content:encoded: Peace and blessings, family. Securing justice for our communities is critical. Still, we must never normalize watching and reading about any violence enacted on our friends and loved ones, pieces of ourselves, on the internet. We give thanks to the ancestors and higher power that guided #JacobBlake back to share more joyful moments with his children like the one in this picture we are intentionally sharing instead of that horrific video. Today we are reminded that it is an essential component of #Blackliberation to take pause and hold space for our whole selves —body, mind, and spirit. To choose healing. #Blackhealingisrevolutionary #BlackLivesMatter
item.author: Black Lives Matter 5280

item.title: From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what...
item.content:encoded:
From @denverpsl: On August 21, 1971, the murder of revolutionary George Jackson at San Quentin State Prison ignited what we celebrate today as #BlackAugust. Black August, first commemorated by our incarcerated brothers and sisters, is a time to recommit ourselves to the struggle for #BlackLiberation and to honor those who’ve contributed to our collective progress and all those who have been lost to unjust violence and systemic racism.
This August 21, join us in a car protest to bring the Black August fight to our local prison walls. We will drive in a mobile protest to the Denver County Jail and the GEO Aurora ICE detention facility to let those who are chained there know that we are with them, we are fighting for them, and we will keep fighting until all chains are broken.
The many injustices faced by those behind bars in the U.S. are today amplified by the COVID-19 pandemic. Prisons and jails all across the country, where medical neglect is commonplace and quarantining impossible, have become hotspots of infection. Hundreds have died in US prisons from COVID-19, and yet no response has been made to defend against unnecessary death. The mass incarceration of Black, Brown, and Indigenous populations means that they are not only disproportionately affected by the virus outside of jail, but inside as well.
We raise the following demands, recognizing that if they are not met, more unnecessary death is a certainty:
1. Immediate humanitarian release of all ICE detainees and all vulnerable inmates, those convicted for non-violent offenses, and those who have not been convicted at all.
2. Where people remain behind bars, drastically increase medical staffing and supplies to local jails and state prisons, and guarantee sanitary conditions for all inmates.
3. Free all political prisoners!
#FreeThemAll #DecarcerateNOW #decarcerateCOVID19

item.title: Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will...
item.content:encoded:
Black Lives Matter 5280

Many have asked about where to donate. We have shared and will continue to share links to bail/legal support fundraising in Denver, Minneapolis and beyond. We encourage friends to donate to BLM5280’s Emergency Fund using Venmo http://venmo.com/BLM5280 . These donations will be used for bail, legal support, and provision of direct services for Black people impacted by the current and ongoing crisis. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation that we will have access to at a later date, you can visit our Colorado Gives Day Page to donate through our fiscal sponsor, Rocky Mountain Peace and Justice Center.

Working with residents and organizations in Denver, Black Lives Matter 5280 assists in building more loving and united Black communities while eliminating anti-Black violence and racism. To expose, address and eradicate structures and systems of oppression in Denver, BLM5280 uses a holistic racial j...
